page.title: 17 KETTERING NEWS IN MAY
page.content: Since New Year's Eve, The Evening Telegraph has launched a Cancer Scanner Appeal to buy an 80,000 pound scanner. The sum of 90,000 pounds has been collected by the readers who held discos, dances, raffles, collections etc. Additional equipment will be bought for the Kettering Health District nuclear medicine department. Meanwhile patients have to travel to Northampton for scanner treatment. 800 Jehovah's Witnesses from all over the world came to Kettering to build a Kingdom Hall costing 50,000 pounds. The foundations were laid last month and they began building on Saturday morning. Of the 300 skilled workers, 50 came from Kettering and more than 100 worked all night. People formed human chains to pass the bricks and 30 hours later the Montagu St building was done.
